intro: Symplococarpon brenesii, commonly known as the Guatemalan starfruit, is a small evergreen shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright orange, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
